Annotation.note:
If the lines joining the vertices $A$, $B$, $C$ of a triangle $ABC$ to a point $S$ meet the respectively opposite sides in $L$, $M$, $N$, and the circle $(LMN)$ meets these sides again in $O$, $P$, $Q$, show that lines $AO$, $BP$, $CQ$ are concurrent.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
